definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: However, both Chinese nation spirits and Chinese contemporary literature have transitionary limitations.
sentences.chinese: 近代中华民族精神和中国近代文学都有过渡性的局限。

sentences.english: The magma, after emplacement, separates into dry magma and transitional ore-forming fluid.
sentences.chinese: 岩浆侵位后分离为干岩浆和过渡性成矿流体。

sentences.english: The subvolcanic complex in the orefield has the transitional characteristic in geology, petrology and geochemistry.
sentences.chinese: 这套潜火山杂岩具过渡性地质地球化学特征。

sentences.english: The characteristics of the floristic elements indicate that this is a transitional pteridoflora from the tropics to the temperates.
sentences.chinese: 地理成分具有明显的从热带向温带的过渡性。

sentences.english: In the history of modern Chinese thought and culture, Feng Guifen was a feudalism capitalism transitional figure.
sentences.chinese: 在中国近代思想文化史上，冯桂芬是个过渡性的人物。

sentences.english: Both camps need to find a transitional figure who can bridge their differences.
sentences.chinese: 两个阵营需要找出一个可以弥合分歧的过渡性人物。

sentences.english: The Catalytic Fund provides transitional assistance to low income countries.
sentences.chinese: 催化基金为低收入国家提供过渡性援助。

sentences.english: Proposals also have been put forward relating to a transitional regional safeguard mechanism.
sentences.chinese: 另外还提出了有关过渡性的区域保障机制的议案。

definition: progress step by step/gradual progress/to move forward (slowly)
specific to a particular stage (of a project etc)/interim (policy etc)/occurring in stages/phased
same as 總而言之|总而言之[zong3 er2 yan2 zhi1]
